info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 18 at 1:29PM PST until November 18 at 4:15PM PST by NWS Las Vegas NV
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast California, including the following county, Inyo.
* WHEN...Until 415 PM PST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 129 PM PST, Heavy rain is beginning to ease across eastern Inyo County. CHP recently reported one foot of flowing water crossing Death Valley road near the California and Nevada stateline. Some roads may be impassable until the rain lets up further this afternoon. Additional rounds of rain will be possible this evening and overnight. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Furnace Creek, Shoshone, Stovepipe Wells, Texas Springs Campground, Death Valley Junction, Homewood Canyon-Valley Wells, Tecopa and Panamint Springs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON
